tnote.storage

Class FileWriteHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • tnote.storage.FileWriteHandler

  • public class FileWriteHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides methods to write to files within the system. Only Strings are written to files. Objects are deserialized into json Strings to be written into files.
    Author:
    A0124131B

    • Method Summary

      Method which appends a String to the end of a list in a specified text file.

      • getInstance

        Gets the instance of FileWriteHandler. If instance does not exist, a new instance is created.

      • writeNameToListFile

        protected boolean writeNameToListFile(java.io.File textFile,
                          java.lang.String taskName)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Method which appends a String to the end of a list in a specified text file.
        Parameters:
        textFile - text file containing the list.
        taskName - String to append to the list.
        Returns:
        true if the String is successfully appended to the text file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Error writing to the file because the file is a directory, or the file cannot be opened, or the file does not exist and cannot be created.

      • writeTaskToTextFile

        protected boolean writeTaskToTextFile(java.io.File textFile,
                          TaskFile task)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Method which converts a TaskFile object into a json String and saves it into a text file.
        Parameters:
        textFile - the text file to open and write the json String to.
        task - the TaskFile object to write to the text file.
        Returns:
        true if the TaskFile object is successfully written into the text file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Error writing to the file because the file is a directory, or the file cannot be opened, or the file does not exist and cannot be created.

      • writeToMonthMapFile

                               throws java.io.IOException
        Method which converts a Map into a json String and saves it into a text file.
        Parameters:
        textFile - the text file to open and write the json String to.
        map - the Map object to be written to the text file.
        Returns:
        true if the Map object is successfully written to the text file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Error writing to the file because the file is a directory, or the file cannot be opened, or the file does not exist and cannot be created.

        Returns:
